description: Dive into "Sun-Kissed Shores of Fethiye" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Sun-Kissed Shores of Fethiye

places.generalDescription: The resort hotel B√ºy√ºk Samanlƒ±k Plajƒ± is a great place for families with kids as the facilities are very cheap, but theres also plenty of activities on offer for people of all ages. The sea here can be a bit dangerous if you're not careful, but its still worth checking out.
places.name: B√ºy√ºk Samanlƒ±k Plajƒ±

reviews.text: This is a really nice beach with a large parking lot, which there is a fee for when you enter. It is free for handicap individuals. The beach is accessible and there is a beach wheelchair that goes right into the water. There is an accessible bathroom, but it's a little difficult to get to, overall there is a caf√©, which looks really nice, but the food was very greasy and not very tasty. There are lounge chairs and the staff is really helpful and friendly. I would wholeheartedly recommend the speech, especially for handicap people. It is a nice family atmosphere and the water is perfect and refreshing.

I got the bus from Fethiye, it stops outside, moving clockwise around the beaches, they run around every thirty mins. It was only 30 TL to enter I had a tea for 10 TL. A local family atmosphere and some cool music. Lifeguard was present. There were two cafes great value for money.

You get what you pay for
50tl for entry, 300 for umbrella and 2 sunbeds, 600 for cabana
Lots of rocks so bring swim shoes
Fish will bite you
Water is quite good however

sources.snippet: Help beach club, located in an idyllic white sandy cove shrouded by luscious pine forests, is a wonderful place to spend the day. This lively beach club offers a restaurant, bar, cafe and evening bar with the kitchen serving food from 09:00 to 23:00 and the bar serving until 03:00. Guests can play volleyball on the beach and a jetty for yatchs to moor is available.

reviews.text: This is an incredible beach club. The service is equivalent to first class. The employees are well organized and always available. We made reservations in advance and were instructed to arrive before 11am. After 11am reservations for that day are cancelled and the chairs become available. This club has everything - restaurant, bar, ice cream station, hookah, changing rooms, showers and a small stand selling beach accessories. The food is really good and we loved our lunch. The water gets deep several feet from the shoreline. There is a lifeguard on duty and banana boat and other water activities available for a price. We spent all day here and it was worth every penny.

A Day at this Perfect Beach Club.

I recently visited this amazing beach club and was absolutely blown away by the whole experience! The location is just out of this world , perfect clean beach , glistening turquoise waters.

The music perfectly complemented the lively atmosphere. With a mix of popular tunes, catchy beats, and summer vibes, it was impossible not to feel uplifted and ready to dance the day away.

As for the service, I have to commend the staff for their professionalism. They were friendly, attentive, and always ready to cater to our every need with a warm smile.

Overall, I can't recommend this beach club enough. If you love stunning surroundings, energetic tunes, and top-notch service, you absolutely must pay a visit!

It is a clean and organized beach. The view and the water are beautiful.

When you make a reservation, you have to check in by 11 am. If you do not do this, unfortunately your reservation will be canceled.

Drink prices are higher than average. The taste of the food is average.

places.generalDescription: The Akmaz Plajƒ± beach is a secluded beach that is great for watching the sun set. It's also dog friendly and affordable. There is a garden cafe close by. The sand here is pebbly, but black near the water's edge.
places.name: Akmaz Plajƒ±

reviews.text: Nice and big beach. There's a car park for 70TL or you might get lucky and find a free spot on the street. There are a lot of trees that make it easy to find some shade. Changing rooms, showers and toilets seemed well maintained. You can rent sunbeds and an umbrella from the kiosk for 225TL.

A magnificent pebble/sand beach. There are trees, a restaurant, and a great view. Everything you need is there, proper showers that stay on and even racks to hang stuff. Nothing fancy, but everything is nice and functional.

What a beautiful beach with incredible views. Part of the beach is privatized by a hotel, but part is free. It is not a sand beach, so you won't lie on the ground and beds you need to pay for, but it is very affordable. There r showers and toilets and a small cafe

places.generalDescription: Boncuklu koyu, also known as Boncuklu Bay, is a stunning coastal spot just a short distance from Fethiye's center. The beach is characterized by its pebbles and sandy shores, offering visitors the chance to enjoy the sparkling waters and expansive sea views. The bay's name originates from the small beads-like pebbles found beneath its clear waters.

sources.snippet: Boncuklu Bay got its name from the small pebbles under the water that look like beads. Located in the camlƒ±k Village region between Gokova and Mugla, the Boncuklu Bay beach is different from other bays due to its many important features.
sources.shortName: Fethiye Beaches - 13 Beaches with Details and Photos

places.name: Boncuklu koyu

reviews.text: This beautiful place is just something else -- the drinks the music the water the beds it's just all amazing and it's one of turkeys places you need to visit. Take the day out to relax and unwind in the peaceful cove it's unreal.
The nature is stunning, but unfortunately they sold this area to corporations focusing only on $$$

Crystal clear sea, perfect horizon line, pink sunset and the sun drowning in the mountains in the distance. The beach can be divided into 3 zones: paid, public, semi-wild. We were on the third, it is difficult to get to it, there is no path as such, but the beach itself is removed from large masses of people. The beach is rocky, the entrance to the sea is convenient, hedgehogs were not noticed, there are a lot of fish to swim in glasses.

places.generalDescription: Easygoing beachfront restaurant & bar serving pasta, grills & pizzas, plus sushi & cocktails.

sources.snippet: Sea Me Beach is a private beach area that you will need to get to early during the peak summer months if you want to secure a sun lounger and parasol. This beach gets very busy, but it‚Äôs a great space to enjoy a beach day with calm waters and golden sand. There are also plenty of facilities on site, including food and refreshments.

places.name: Sea Me Beach

reviews.text:
Sea Me Beach, located in B√ºy√ºk Boncuklu Bay in Fethiye, Turkey, is a luxurious beach destination that blends minimalism with a bohemian touch, providing a perfect escape into nature. Known for its turquoise waters and stunning Mediterranean views, it offers an adults-only concept with elegant sunbeds, cabanas, and gourmet dining options. The beach features a fusion of Mediterranean and East Asian cuisine, paired with handcrafted cocktails, creating an unforgettable culinary experience.

Visitors can enjoy paddleboarding, sunset parties, and day-long DJ performances, making it an excellent spot for relaxation and entertainment. With a focus on comfort and exclusivity, Sea Me Beach promises a memorable seaside getaway. Entry fees are tiered, with options for regular areas or premium comfort zones.

This is the most beautiful beach I've ever been to. The atmosphere was amazing, great music, good restaurants, and everything you need to have a great time. It's a bit pricey but I think it is worth it.

I'm honestly surprised by some of the negative reviews about this place. Of course, everyone has their own experience, but for me, everything was great. The food was delicious, and I didn't find the sunbed prices unreasonable at all. The staff was quick and attentive throughout the day.

In the evening, we moved to their other section for an event-which, I have to say, had an even better atmosphere. The ambiance and the crowd were truly top-notch. However, the service during the event really fell short. It took forever to get drinks, and the alcohol was significantly overpriced. The line was so long and the prices so steep that no one in our group could actually enjoy a proper drink, let alone get tipsy.

Overall, it's a beautiful spot with a lot of potential, but the evening event experience could definitely be improved-especially the bar service.

places.generalDescription: √áalƒ±≈ü Beach is a stunning sandy beach in Fethiye, Turkey, offering a perfect setting for sunbathing, swimming, and enjoying breathtaking sunsets. The area is known for its vibrant atmosphere with numerous bars and restaurants. Fethiye boasts an array of beautiful beaches including the famous Oludeniz beaches with crystal clear waters ideal for water sports. The region also offers opportunities for hot air balloon rides and exploration from above.

sources.snippet: Here is the list of most popular and best beaches in Fethiye Turkey as well beaches located nearby including famous Oludeniz (Belcekiz and Blue Lagoon) and Calis Beach (municipal Fethiye beach) and not that much popular but nice like Kidrak beach, Kaputas beach, Gemiler beach, Aksazlar, Kuleli Koyu and Karaot. By all means beach lovers can find their own favorite beach in Fethiye and nearby area. Should be noticed that there are no Hisaronu beaches because there is not sea coast in Hisaronu, hence the closest beach is Oludeniz.

The scent of pine, crystal clear water and the village‚Äôs charming market places; It is possible to see and experience all these at Kuleli Beach (Kuleli Village). It is one of the beaches of Fethiye located a little far from the center of Fethiye and there is a restaurant, toilet, shower cabin, sun loungers and umbrella rental opportunities. The beach of Kuleli Bay consists of pebbles and is generally preferred by families with small children, since the sea is shallow.
sources.shortName: Fethiye Beaches - 13 Beaches with Details and Photos

sources.snippet: Calis Beach is the longest beach in Fethiye, running for around 2.5km, and it is the closest to the center of Fethiye town. As such, it is very busy during the summer months, but its size makes it easy to find a spot on the sand. This beach is also famous as a breeding ground for Caretta Carette turtles, and as such, it is protected.

places.name: √áalƒ±≈ü Beach

reviews.text: It's a beautiful beach, a romantic place with friendly people, especially at Jive Beach Resort. It's relaxing, offers excellent food, and provides outstanding service.

Lovely beach, pretty long, nice for a walk. I spent 6 weeks there next to the beach in December 2024 and January 2025 and liked it. It's partly dark sand, the rest are stones. Usually clean. Mountain view in the background and islands around were a bonus. Nice for sunsets. Many locals go there with chairs and tables and eat and drink.

Some parts of the beach were quiet, mostly on week days, but it got too busy on weekends and in the afternoona in general. As an introvert, I would not enjoy the Calis beach in summer when it gets overcrowded. In winter it was still fine for me on weekdays.

What I did not enjoy: way too many people smoking on the beach, they do not care at all if there's any non-smokers around (for a lifelong non-smoker, it was disgusting to me). And also many locals were fishing there, jus anywhere among other people who went there for a swim (yes, I did go for a swim even in winter when the water was not very warm but that's why I was staying next to the beach) and it was bothering having to check the fishing sticks and lines all around me. It's very inconsiderate that the fishermen do not stick to the end of the beach in order not to disturb other people who are not on the beach for fishing.

As someone who has spent her entire life in Fethiye-from birth through childhood and high school-I'd like to share a few thoughts about √áalƒ±≈ü Beach (√áalƒ±≈ü Plajƒ±).

Let me say this upfront: the water at √áalƒ±≈ü isn't the cleanest or most pristine you'll find. That's a fact anyone can figure out, whether they're visiting for the first time or have lived here for years. But the real charm of √áalƒ±≈ü isn't in its water quality-it's in the experience.

√áalƒ±≈ü is one of those rare beaches where you can walk barefoot on soft sand, where the shore doesn't feel like it's fenced off or commercialized with a cordon or barrier. You're not forced to pay high entrance fees, buy overpriced drinks, or reserve a sunbed just to enjoy the sea. There's a quiet kind of justice in that. You can just be.

The view here is stunning, especially at sunset-one of the best in all of Fethiye. You can grab a cold beer from a nearby bakkal, walk down to the beach, and enjoy it with your loved ones without bothering anyone. It's that simple. That free. You can walk, breathe, watch the Knight Island across the bay, and feel like you're in a space that welcomes you as you are.

There are wonderful restaurants around too-especially fish restaurants-and the pubs feel just right for Fethiye. The atmosphere is unpretentious, friendly, and open. √áalƒ±≈ü offers a kind of democratic beauty-natural and social-that makes the friendships and memories you form here feel extra special and lasting.

That said, I also want to offer a sincere warning. The water here may look calm and inviting, but it can get surprisingly deep after just a few steps. I say this as someone who nearly drowned here as a child, despite being a strong swimmer today. If you don't know how to swim, don't go in alone. It's deceptive. The sea bottom drops quickly, and before you know it, you're in over your head. There's also a fair amount of underwater moss, which might feel unpleasant or slippery.

So please-enjoy √áalƒ±≈ü, but do so with care. Let yourself go with the flow, but not without a sense of awareness and respect for the sea.

places.generalDescription: Kuleli Beach Club is a hidden gem that captivates visitors with its stunning natural beauty and tranquil atmosphere. Nestled in a serene location, this beach club features inviting sun loungers along the pristine shoreline and charming Turkish Kosks, which provide cozy seating around a picturesque lake at its heart. The large platform extending into the crystal-clear waters invites guests to stroll or take a refreshing plunge into the sea.

sources.snippet: Kuleli Beach Club has a unique layout with a large lake at the centre of it‚Äôs facitlities. Located in a secluded spot this club has sun loungers along the sea front on it‚Äôs beach and charming Turkish K√∂≈üks (large covered seating groups with cushions) surrounding a small lake at the centre  of the beach club. A large platform reaches out into the clean seawaters for visitors to walk along or jump into the sea.

Smell of pine, crystal clear water and far enough from hassle of the town ‚Äì all this is Kuleli Beach (Kuleli Koyu). It is one of the remotely located Fethiye beaches - on Fethiye peninsula and has restaurant, toilets, shower cabins, sunbeds and umbrellas for rent. Kuleli is pebble, shallow beach so great for whole family and children friendly.

places.name: Kuleli Beach Club

reviews.text: Came here on the 7th Of August 2022 it was an amazing experience me and the family loved it. It is very child friendly the food and refreshments were sensational with a wide array of choices. The staff were fast and friendly making me and the family feel at home. This will be the place me and my family visit every time we come to Fethiye could not recommend it enough. Thank you from the Saleh family.

Cost: 20 TL Per Person is enforced whether or not you're actually renting out their seats and umbrellas. This is very expensive and they need to understand that making it expensive to enter makes me less likely to spend inside which is exactly what happened. They charge 20TL for children 12 and older. So heads up on that too.

Hygiene: They have decently clean bathrooms. We did not see any showers which was unfortunate. The seats were decent.

Food: They have food and drinks. Beers are 20 TL. Dishes with meat are around 30 TL. Tea is 3.50 TL. The prices are high but not crazy high. They work with a card system. So you load money in the beginning and pay with that card. They said they return the unused money when you exit. We did not buy anything so I can't report back on any more than that.

The beach: Rocky beach with beautiful clear and warm water.

Other options: if you have your own car there are similar places you can probably go to without having to pay per person. I would say most places will cost 25 TL to park your car and not take per person fees so this is quite a bit more than what most places cost.
Nice private beach, very clean and organized. The service and facilities are on point. The only downside would be a bit overpriced sunbeds and cabins.

places.generalDescription: Alesta Beach Club is a serene beach destination that offers a perfect blend of relaxation and vibrant nightlife. By day, it's an idyllic spot to unwind on sunbeds, enjoy refreshing drinks, and bask in the sun while savoring delectable snacks and meals. The beach is secluded, clean, and well-maintained with friendly staff ensuring a chilled-out atmosphere.

sources.snippet: And then you have the Instagram-friendly B√ºy√ºk Boncuklu and K√º√ß√ºk Boncuklu, operating as Sea Me Beach and So Beach, respectively, at the moment.
sources.shortName: Fethiye Beaches - The Most Popular Bays & Hidden Coves

places.name: Alesta Beach Club

reviews.text: The place is very secluded, private and calming. Ideal place for a serene getaway in Fethiye. I would also like to mention that the food and service were amazing. The recommendations & service of Batuhan has been incredible. Definitely recommend staying at Alesta or if you have pre-booked elsewhere, make sure to visit their private beach - it has affordable prices & exceptional views.

Its a nice private beach, the price is 40TL for using the facilities. We were seatting at the restaurant, and only pay for our food. We had nice Turkish pancackes, made on spot. With meat or vegetables. Nice view of Fethiye across the bay.

Do not go here as a tourist!

I stopped by for a drink break (no beach or sunbed use), we ordered some tea and water - after waiting for 20 minutes the tea never showed up and when we went pay the man demanded that we pay 200TL for the one bottle of water, even though the menu said 90TL. Absolutely appalling service and hospitality - very disappointing in such a lovely country üáπüá∑

places.address: Karag√∂zler Mah Fevzi √áakmak Cad. Letonya Tatil K√∂y√º Yanƒ±, 48300 Fethiye/Muƒüla, T√ºrkiye

reviews.text: So much better than Olu deniz ! No crowds , cheap prices, drive right up to the beach .
Calm and nice beaches

Not sand but rocks beach
You can drive till the sea

sources.snippet: And then you have the Instagram-friendly B√ºy√ºk Boncuklu and K√º√ß√ºk Boncuklu, operating as Sea Me Beach and So Beach, respectively, at the moment.
sources.shortName: Fethiye Beaches - The Most Popular Bays & Hidden Coves

reviews.text:
K√º√ß√ºk Boncuklu Bay is a hidden slice of paradise tucked away along the Fethiye coastline - quiet, raw, and strikingly beautiful. Unlike the more crowded beaches nearby, this small cove offers a peaceful retreat into nature where the sea sparkles in deep shades of turquoise and green, framed by pine-covered hills.

The beach is made up of small pebbles, which keeps the water crystal clear and perfect for snorkeling or simply floating and watching the sunlight dance on the surface. There's a small, charming beach establishment that provides sunbeds, drinks, and a few simple but tasty food options, yet the overall feel remains untouched and authentic.

What sets K√º√ß√ºk Boncuklu apart is its intimate atmosphere. It's not overly polished or touristy - instead, it offers the kind of calm that only comes from places that haven't been overrun. You can hear the cicadas, feel the breeze, and just‚Ä¶ breathe.

It's ideal for couples, solo travelers, or anyone looking to escape into nature for a few hours. Just be sure to bring water shoes if you're not used to pebble beaches, and a good book if you plan to stay - because once you're here, you won't want to leave anytime soon.

Scootered/Walked over here from the old town in Fethiye. Took us 45 minutes after a scooter (10 mins) from the old town. It's expensive for a bed (750TL each) but worth it for a beautiful beach, lovely vibe with chilled beats, and good service. Watch out for the drink and food prices but overall the luxury was appreciated.
Great fun. Food in restaurant over the bridge to the right is lovely.  Got river ride there too. ¬£10 each. Ice creams in car park amazing.

places.generalDescription: K√º√ß√ºk Samanlƒ±k Plajƒ± is a hidden gem that perfectly embodies the serene beauty of Turkey's coastline. Known for its stunning views and crystal-clear waters, this beach is also a popular paragliding spot, making it an exciting destination for adventure seekers. Visitors rave about the cleanliness and well-maintained facilities, with friendly staff always ready to assist. The beach offers comfortable loungers at reasonable prices, allowing guests to relax without breaking the bank.

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôve ever seen an advertisement for √ñl√ºdeniz, in fact, for Turkey‚Äôs beach resorts in general, you‚Äôve seen this beach. It‚Äôs also the most famous spot for paragliding.
Hugely popular with locals ‚Äì especially at weekends ‚Äì are B√ºy√ºk Samanlƒ±k and K√º√ß√ºk Samanlƒ±k bays just beyond the all-inclusive confines of the Club & Hotel Letoonia.
sources.shortName: Fethiye Beaches - The Most Popular Bays & Hidden Coves

places.name: K√º√ß√ºk Samanlƒ±k Plajƒ±

reviews.text: Nice beach in quiet forrest with sundbeds on the sun or in the sun shadow. Entrance is 300 lira per person and they have amazing staff always ready to take your order! Food is really good and prices are resonable. Recommendation!

We loved this place. Of course we came on a day that wasn't super full so that definitely helped to have a better experience.
They have different options of sun beds and umbrellas, you can choose any of them after paying the entrance fee which is 600 TL.
The food was very nice too and the service was perfect, we want to thank specially our waiter Arda for taking very good care of us and being so helpful and nice.
I saw comments about the beach being too rocky, to be honest it wasn't a problem at all, it's not even that rocky.
Also no fish was biting you üòÖ
We will be back

I've had the pleasure of visiting K√º√ß√ºk Samanlƒ±k Plajƒ±, and it truly left an impression I'd love to share-this hidden gem offers a perfect blend of natural beauty, thoughtful amenities, and a deeply calming atmosphere.

From the moment I arrived, the setting felt like stepping into a tranquil sanctuary. Nestled along a quiet peninsula near Fethiye, this cove is embraced by green hills and pine trees, offering shade and a lush backdrop to the shimmering Aegean waters. Ôøº The beach isn't large-roughly 130 meters of golden sand mixing with pebbles-but its size only adds to the intimate and peaceful vibe. Ôøº

The water here is nothing short of magical-clear, calm, and inviting. At times, it resembles an aquarium, especially on windless mornings when the surface is glassy. Ôøº I did notice some sharp rocks along certain entry points, so I'd highly recommend wearing water shoes for a more comfortable entry. Ôøº

Despite being privately operated, the beach maintains an affordable and welcoming feel. There's a modest entrance fee-around 300‚ÄØTRY per person during peak season-to access the beach, including amenities like sunbeds and umbrellas. Ôøº It's worth every kuru≈ü because the staff are exceptionally friendly and attentive, consistently ready to take your order or assist as needed. Ôøº

Convenience is a priority here. A well-positioned parking area lies close to restrooms, showers, and changing cabins. Ôøº Ôøº Even when parking isn't free, it's well worth it for the comfort and peace of mind it offers. Ôøº

Facilities go beyond the basics-there's a neat caf√©-bar on site with a menu of snacks, sandwiches, pasta, and refreshing drinks, all reasonably priced. Ôøº The place has a relaxed, upbeat vibe, with nice music in the background that enhances the ambience without ever being overpowering. Ôøº Ôøº

One of the most special moments for me was spotting sea turtles gliding near the cliffs-unexpected, delightful, and soul-stirring. Ôøº

Timing your visit can enrich the experience further. I chose to go in May, and the beach was peaceful-practically deserted at times, giving me a rare sense of personal paradise. Ôøº In contrast, summer weekends can bring more locals and families, which is great if you enjoy a livelier scene-but if peace is what you're after, May, June, or early September are golden months.

Of course, everything isn't perfect. The rocky entry points and occasional slippery wooden decking mean caution is advised. Ôøº Ôøº Also, there are small complaints about occasional maintenance needs, like slippery steps or algae on some platforms-but these are minor in context. Ôøº Ôøº

In sum, K√º√ß√ºk Samanlƒ±k Plajƒ± is a standout-serene, beautifully maintained, and just the right blend of service and natural charm. Whether you're looking to escape for a quiet swim, enjoy a peaceful sun lounger under the trees, or spot a sea turtle while sipping a cold drink, this beach delivers in spades. A hidden slice of coastal heaven near Fethiye that I wholeheartedly recommend.

places.generalDescription: Towered Beach offers a refreshing swimming experience in its clear teal waters, surrounded by well-maintained tropical greenery and convenient paved pathways. The beach features canvas tents for shaded relaxation and provides facilities for sunbeds and umbrellas. Nestled amidst smooth seas and rocky hills, it offers a serene natural setting. Visitors can also enjoy hiking around the island's mountainous terrain or take a peaceful scooter ride along the island's roads after a day at the beach.

sources.snippet: The scent of pine, crystal clear water and the village‚Äôs charming market places; It is possible to see and experience all these at Kuleli Beach (Kuleli Village). It is one of the beaches of Fethiye located a little far from the center of Fethiye and there is a restaurant, toilet, shower cabin, sun loungers and umbrella rental opportunities. The beach of Kuleli Bay consists of pebbles and is generally preferred by families with small children, since the sea is shallow.
sources.shortName: Fethiye Beaches - 13 Beaches with Details and Photos

places.name: Towered Beach

reviews.text:
5* nature beauty
5* service
5* stuff
4* price
4* #accessibility
Amazing place to enjoy peacefully the sea, to hike around the island mountain, and to stay very close to the city at the same time.
I didn't see any hiking trails, but the road around the island is very quite with only few cats per some time, so it's rather good to hike. If take a scooter it might be even more fascinating to ride around the island after a beach session, both directions bring up completely different horizons. I recommend to do both, but if you are limited in time take the one starting to the right (East direction) from the beach.
At the beach there are very comfortable chaise longs, restrooms, parking & savage place too. But might be argued that it's a bit expensive though. #accessibility is preserved by flat solid surface near the beach & accessible restrooms.
Be careful,that this beach is separated for men/women/family and requires special swim suites for women (closed). Price is 80TRL per person
We skipped it since the front guy said it is 1000TL per person to enter, July 2025!
